00006 #define COMPONENT_NAME "btac"
00007 
00008 #ifdef BPRED_PARSE_ARGS
00009 if(!strcasecmp(COMPONENT_NAME,type))
00010 {
00011   int num_ents;
00012   int num_ways;
00013   int tag_width;
00014   char replace_policy;
00015   if(sscanf(opt_string,"%*[^:]:%[^:]:%d:%d:%d:%c",name,&num_ents,&num_ways,&tag_width,&replace_policy) != 5)
00016     fatal("bad BTB options string %s (should be \"btac:name:entries:ways:tag-width:replacement_policy\")",opt_string);
00017   return new BTB_btac_t(name,num_ents,num_ways,tag_width,replace_policy);
00018 }
00019 #else

00022 class BTB_btac_t:public BTB_t
00023 {
00024   /* struct definitions */
00025   struct BTB_btac_Entry_t
00026   {
00027     md_addr_t PC;
00028     md_addr_t target;
00029     struct BTB_btac_Entry_t * prev;
00030     struct BTB_btac_Entry_t * next;
00031   };
00032 
00033   class BTB_btac_sc_t:public BTB_sc_t
00034   {
00035     public:
00036     struct BTB_btac_Entry_t * p;
00037     struct BTB_btac_Entry_t ** set;
00038   };
00039 
00040   protected:
00041   int num_entries;
00042   int num_ways;
00043   int tag_width;
00044   int tag_mask;
00045   int tag_shift;
00046   char replacement_policy;
00047   struct BTB_btac_Entry_t ** set;
00048 
00049   int btac_mask;
00050 
00051   public:
00052   /* CREATE */
00053   BTB_btac_t(char * const arg_name,
00054              const int arg_num_entries,
00055              const int arg_num_ways,
00056              const int arg_tag_width,
00057              const char arg_replacement_policy
00058             )
00059   {
00060     init();
00061 
00062     /* TODO: error check parameters */
00063     CHECK_PPOW2(arg_num_entries);
00064     CHECK_POS(arg_num_ways);
00065     if((mytolower(arg_replacement_policy) != 'l') && (mytolower(arg_replacement_policy) != 'r'))
00066       fatal("%s(%s) %s must be 'l' (LRU) or 'r' (random).",name,COMPONENT_NAME,"replacement_policy");
00067 
00068     name = strdup(arg_name);
00069     if(!name)
00070       fatal("couldn't malloc btac name (strdup)");
00071 
00072     num_entries = arg_num_entries;
00073     num_ways = arg_num_ways;
00074     replacement_policy = arg_replacement_policy;
00075     tag_width = arg_tag_width;
00076 
00077     btac_mask = num_entries-1;
00078     tag_shift = log_base2(num_entries);
00079     tag_mask = (1<<tag_width)-1;
00080 
00081     set = (struct BTB_btac_Entry_t**) calloc(num_entries,sizeof(*set));
00082     if(!set)
00083       fatal("couldn't malloc btac set array");
00084     for(int i=0;i<num_entries;i++)
00085     {
00086       struct BTB_btac_Entry_t * p;
00087       for(int j=0;j<num_ways;j++)
00088       {
00089         p = (struct BTB_btac_Entry_t*) calloc(1,sizeof(**set));
00090         if(!p)
00091           fatal("couldn't malloc btac entry");
00092         if(set[i])
00093         {
00094           p->next = set[i];
00095           set[i]->prev = p;
00096           set[i] = p;
00097         }
00098         else
00099           set[i] = p;
00100       }
00101     }
00102 
00103     int tagsize = 8*sizeof(md_addr_t) - log_base2(num_entries);
00104     int lrusize = log_base2(num_ways);
00105     int entrysize = sizeof(md_addr_t) + tagsize + lrusize + 1; /* +1 for valid bit */
00106     bits =  num_entries*num_ways*entrysize;
00107     type = strdup(COMPONENT_NAME);
00108   }
00109 
00110   /* DESTROY */
00111   ~BTB_btac_t()
00112   {
00113     free(name); name = NULL;
00114     free(type); type = NULL;
00115     for(int i=0;i<num_entries;i++)
00116     {
00117       struct BTB_btac_Entry_t * p;
00118       struct BTB_btac_Entry_t * next = NULL;
00119       for(p=set[i];p;p = next)
00120       {
00121         next = p->next;
00122         free(p);
00123       }
00124     }
00125     free(set); set = NULL;
00126   }
00127 
00128   /* LOOKUP */
00129   BTB_LOOKUP_HEADER
00130   {
00131     class BTB_btac_sc_t * sc = (class BTB_btac_sc_t*) scvp;
00132     int index = PC & btac_mask;
00133     struct BTB_btac_Entry_t * p = set[index];
00134 
00135     BPRED_STAT(lookups++;)
00136     sc->updated = false;
00137 
00138     sc->set = &set[index];
00139     sc->p = NULL;
00140 
00141     while(p)
00142     {
00143       if(p->PC == ((PC>>tag_shift)&tag_mask))
00144       {
00145         sc->p = p;
00146         return p->target;
00147       }
00148       p = p->next;
00149     }
00150 
00151     return 0;
00152   }
00153 
00154   /* UPDATE */
00155   BTB_UPDATE_HEADER
00156   {
00157     class BTB_btac_sc_t * sc = (class BTB_btac_sc_t*) scvp;
00158 
00159     if(!outcome) /* don't store not-taken targets */
00160     {
00161       BPRED_STAT(num_nt++;)
00162       return;
00163     }
00164 
00165     if(!sc->updated)
00166     {
00167       BPRED_STAT(updates++;)
00168       BPRED_STAT(num_hits += oPC == our_target;)
00169       sc->updated = true;
00170     }
00171 
00172     if(!our_pred)
00173     {
00174       int index = PC & btac_mask;
00175       struct BTB_btac_Entry_t * p = set[index];
00176 
00177       sc->set = &set[index];
00178       sc->p = NULL;
00179 
00180       while(p)
00181       {
00182         if(p->PC == ((PC>>tag_shift)&tag_mask))
00183         {
00184           sc->p = p;
00185           break;
00186         }
00187         p = p->next;
00188       }
00189     }
00190 
00191     if(sc->p)
00192     {
00193       /* had a BTB hit; update the target, put to front of list */
00194       sc->p->target = oPC;
00195       
00196       if(sc->p->prev == NULL) /* already at head */
00197         return;
00198       sc->p->prev->next = sc->p->next;
00199       if(sc->p->next)
00200         sc->p->next->prev = sc->p->prev;
00201 
00202       (*sc->set)->prev = sc->p;
00203       sc->p->prev = NULL;
00204       sc->p->next = (*sc->set);
00205       *sc->set = sc->p;
00206       return;
00207     }
00208     else
00209     {
00210       /* was a BTB miss; evict entry depending on replacement policy,
00211          update, and put to front of list */
00212       struct BTB_btac_Entry_t * p;
00213       int pos=0;
00214       int randpos=0;
00215       p = *sc->set;
00216       if(replacement_policy == 'r')
00217         randpos = random()%num_ways;
00218 
00219       while(p)
00220       {
00221         if(replacement_policy == 'l' && !p->next)
00222           break;
00223         else if(replacement_policy == 'r' && pos==randpos)
00224           break;
00225         else
00226           pos++;
00227         p = p->next;
00228       }
00229 
00230       assert(p != NULL);
00231 
00232       p->target = oPC;
00233       p->PC = (PC>>tag_shift)&tag_mask;
00234       
00235       if(p->prev == NULL) /* already at head */
00236         return;
00237 
00238       p->prev->next = p->next;
00239       if(p->next)
00240         p->next->prev = p->prev;
00241 
00242       (*sc->set)->prev = p;
00243       p->prev = NULL;
00244       p->next = *sc->set;
00245       *sc->set = p;
00246       return;
00247     }
00248   }
00249 
00250   /* GET_CACHE */
00251   BTB_GET_CACHE_HEADER
00252   {
00253     class BTB_btac_sc_t * sc = new BTB_btac_sc_t();
00254     if(!sc)
00255       fatal("couldn't malloc btac state cache");
00256     return sc;
00257   }
00258 
00259 };

00262 #endif /* BTB_PARSE_ARGS */
